description.en: The lab course will introduce laboratory methods and techniques from the fields of physics, chemistry, genetics, micro-, molecular and cell biology, gene technology, bioengineering and robotics.. Students will get both theoretical knowledge and practical experience in different methods like chemical titration, Western blot, PCR, Gel electrophoresis, DNA extraction, use microscope to determine bacteria, get hands-on experience in LEGO robot construction. Furthermore, students will learn how to write scientific report, analyze the obtained results, troubleshoot. Students will complete practical assignments and tests, write and submit reports.
description.et: Tutvustatakse lihtsamaid praktilisi meetodeid füüsikas, keemias, geenitehnoloogias, biotehnoloogias ja robootikas

objectives.en:
The aim of this course is to give theoretical background and practical experience in the following areas of physics, chemistry, biology and robotics.
Students will become familiar with the following techniques:
1) Chemical titration
2) Western blot
3) PCR
4) Gel electrophoresis
5) DNA extraction
6) Plasmid purification
7) restriction analysis
8) preparation and negative staining of human oral microbiome to explore the morphology of different microbes inhabiting oral cavity; 
9) preparation and simple staining of a pure culture of one bacterial strain; 
10) determination of susceptibility/resistance of different bacteria to lyzosyme;
11) determination of the ability to use citrate and urea as carbon source by different bacteria;
12) Sub-culturing attached cell lines requiring trypsin; 
13) Thawing frozen cells; 
14) Fixing attached cells in paraformaldehyde
15) Investigation of random quantity distribution law using AC grid voltage
16) Determining the power and efficiency of a solar cell 
 
Students will improve their skills in:
1) writing scientific report
2) analyzing the results of the experiment
Students will learn to operate simple light microscope, construct  LEGO robot.
objectives.et: Üliõpilane saab selgeks laboratoorse töö peamised reeglid, kvaliteedinõuded ja lihtsamad meetodid.

learning_outcomes.en:
By the end of the course students will be able to:
1) write scientific report
2) analyze the results of the experiment
Students will become familiar with the following techniques:
1) Chemical titration
2) Western blot
3) PCR
4) Gel electrophoresis
5) DNA extraction
6) Plasmid purification
7) restriction analysis
8) preparation and negative staining of human oral microbiome to explore the morphology of different microbes inhabiting oral cavity; 
9) preparation and simple staining of a pure culture of one bacterial strain; 
10) determination of susceptibility/resistance of different bacteria to lyzosyme;
11) determination of the ability to use citrate and urea as carbon source by different bacteria;
12) Sub-culturing attached cell lines requiring trypsin; 
13) Thawing frozen cells; 
14) Fixing attached cells in paraformaldehyde
15) Investigation of random quantity distribution law using AC grid voltage
16) Determining the power and efficiency of a solar cell 
 
Students will be able to operate simple light microscope, construct  LEGO robot.
learning_outcomes.et: Kursusest osavõtjale antakse esmane kogemus laboratoorse töö alal.

independent_work.et: Practicum supervisor will provide all instructions

description.et: Investigation of random quantity distribution law using AC grid voltage
Determining the power and efficiency of a solar cell
Synthesis and decomposition of basic copper carbonate
Determination of concentration by titration
Test on 4 practical assignments - Molecular testing, Genetics, Microbiology, Cell Culture
Robotics assignments
Bacterial Transformation, Induction of Protein Expression, Protein Gel electroforesis.

grade_preconditions.et: 9 out of 11 practical assignments must be completed successfully

grade_evaluation.et: 9 out of 11 practical assignments must be completed successfully

description.et: Determining the power and efficiency of a solar cell.
Investigation of random quantity distribution law using AC grid voltage. Part 1
Investigation of random quantity distribution law using AC grid voltage. Part 2
Investigation of random quantity distribution law using AC grid voltage. Part 3
Bacterial Transformation, Induction of Protein Expression, Protein Gel electroforesis. Part 1
Bacterial Transformation, Induction of Protein Expression, Protein Gel electroforesis. Part 2
Genetics - purifying a plasmid from bacterial cells. Analysis of purified plasmid (assessment of plasmid yield by spectrophotometry, restriction analysis)

Microbiology. Preparation of wet mount and live staining of yeast cells. Simple staining of bacteria from yoghurt and negative staining of human oral microbiome. Microscopy of specimens. Aseptic inoculation technique. Determination of the ability to use citrate as carbon source by different bacteria. Calculation of the number of bacteria in air. Safety in microbiology lab.
Molecular testing - Genetic testing of CCR5 32bp deletion
Cell culture - Sub-culturing of the attached cell lines; Fixing attached cells in paraformaldehyde
Test on 4 practical sessions: molecular testing, microbiology, genetics, cell culture
Robotics Part 1
Robotics Part 2
Introduction to chemistry practical part. ( safety rules, equipment)
Synthesis and decomposition of basic copper carbonate
Determination of concentration by titration

audience.et: ONLY for Science and Technology curricula students!
